text:
To update the `CUdevice_attribute_enum`, I
1. `cd /res/wrap`
2. `julia`
3. `] activated .`
4. `include("wrap.jl")`

but the output feels like it's not installing the latest version of everything, since it installs according to the local `Project.toml` and `Manifest.toml` files. Should I modify these two files (feels tidious) or update the packages later by `] up` later (but it is taking too much time)? Are there other methods?

The output now (BTW the downloads for both `CUDA` and `CUDA_full` were stuck at 17.5%. The first ctrl+c makes the download continue to run, the second ctrl+c makes it abort):

text: CSTParse has also changed significantly, so an update will take some time. but I did some work yesterday already, so I hope to be able to upgrade to CUDA 11.1 today, 11.2 as soon as we have a compatible CUDNN/CUTENSOR release.
